body.p:
To his excellency Thomas E Bramlette Esq
Gov of Kentucky

Your Humble petitioner, would respectfully represent that he was fined, $10_ in the Court of John Patrick Esq of Magoffin County for the Charged offense of fornication He Says he is innocent of the charge and is a very poor man Having lost almost all his property by rebel invasion and guerilla bands. He has a large family and if he is forced to pay this amount he will be taking the same from his innocent babes, there mother, being dead, Wherefore he asks, your Excellency to remit the above fail and release your humble petitioner of an onerous burden_ May 16th 1864
We Join in the above petition with Asa T Dunn and ask for a remittance as above_ May 16th 1864

W J Coffee S. M. C
Jasone Salyer
At redwine
E F Gullett
David Amett.
E Evans
Wm Baby
Jackson Adams
Reuben Amett Jr
P F Gullett
R L Cooper
J W Patrick
John Power
Wiley Gullett
William Craft
Jacob Risner
J. E. Cooper Co atty
Salyerville Ky
July 19th 1864.
To His Excellency

Thos E Bramlett Esq Gov of Ky if you find the cases of Mr Dunn, and Mrs Risner, deserving your interposition, and you feel disposed to remit the same direct their remittance to the undersigned Louisa Ky.

Yr obt Srvt
D. D. Sublett
P.S. the Sheriff of this county informs me that he will be in Frankfort about the middle of next month and you can send the by him I will write by him

Justice Court
Magoffin Co
vs
Asa T. Dunn
$10-
Remitted
30th May/65
